item.title: [ 79] /ptg/ - Private Trackers General
item.description:
DOE EDITION

The mission of /ptg/ is to promote the highest possible standards of tracker service by providing members with opportunities for professional development, by recognizing technical competence through examinations and by advancing the interests of its members. Concomitant with our dedication to infrastructural excellence and meritocratic recognition, /ptg/ remains unencumbered by the ubiquity of publicly accessible resources. Parallel redundancies on inferior platforms are neither noteworthy nor welcomed... (too long)

>Have a question?
- FAQ https://archive.is/UVQkn
- WIKI https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki/Private_trackers
- NEWFAG PYRAMID https://inviteroute.github.io/graph or https://inviteroute.github.io/sheet/
- STUDY https://www.cambridge.org/core/services/aop-cambridge-core/content/view/2F379FE0CB50DF502F0075119FD3E060
- SPREADSHEET https://hdvinnie.github.io/Private-Trackers-Spreadsheet/
- TEN CURRY COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/dBbdE73M (embed)
- TEN NEON COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/Ud2pGYaE (embed)
- RED SPAMMER'S BIBLE https://rentry.org/69zbxh4h
Use >>>/g/ptg as a link to find the /ptg/ thread.

Remember the following:
>READ THE OP BEFORE MAKING A FUCKING QUESTION YOU RETARDED FAGGOT
>It doesn't matter if you use the same username in different trackers, the staff still share your IP with each other.
>Staff is not reading, being /marked/ IS a meme, and even if it isn't, it is.
>Don't ask for invites, it's private for a reason.
>If starting out you should interview for RED, rank to Torrent Master, wait on account age, and get invites from there. THAT'S IT THAT IS ALL YOU HAVE TO DO.

>【NEWS】
>>105899727 Anon reminds Poltards to gtfo
>>105900024 sneak peak into deepbassnine
>>105901046 Pedro crying to get moar money
>>105903330 DDL websites are always inferior

item.title: [ 65] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 210: Psy x Family Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art and/or make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokémon-related gens.

NovelAI v4.5 is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Midjourney is a paid AI generator, also capable of video. Usage requires a monthly subscription, with basically infinite gens.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL·E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‘buzz’ currency. You get a certain amount every day, plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Tensor is another generator that gives free daily credits, as well as a vast library of LoRAs to train your prompts on. Subscriptions are available for those who wish to pursue more than this.
>https://tensor.art/

Pastebin of Pokémon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 50 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokémon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread: >>57993521

Original filename: Spy x Family.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 73] >be me >go to mcdonalds >order 50 dollars worth of food - including 1 40 piec
item.description:
>be me
>go to mcdonalds
>order 50 dollars worth of food - including 1 40 piece mcnugget
>in the app
>app maxes u out at 6 sauces
>I like extra to dip my fries
>get order
>black female employee standing there helping another man
>clearly expects me to just take my stuff and vamoos
>ask politely for a few extra sweet and sour sauces (I have NEVER had a mcdonalds refuse - I remember visiting Mexico decades ago and THERE they charge u for sauces)
>she tells me she isn't supposed to do that and I have 6 already
>say I ordered a lot of food
>she reluctantly gives me one more (apparently that is the limit)
>doesn't even try to say "ok extra sauces are blah blah cents for more"
>I would have bought more or whatever but she was so rude about it I just gave her a sour face, took my food, and walked away with my one allotted extra sauce
>as I am walking out she starts loudly rambling in her "fake polite" voice about how those are the rules and she doesn't want to get fired
I totally see why blacks were slaves now. They just love enforcing petty rules. They live for it. It's all they have. I've never had this happen at a McDonalds before - they usually just give you 2-3 sauces and let u go.
This wasn't like in the ghetto per se it was in a rural farming area where there's too much diversity. Also, on the way back to my car a different black woman complimented my hair and then begged me for money.

I also got yelled at for filling up my water bag (camelbak) with ice at a McDonalds a few months ago - by a black woman. Have never had a white person yell at me about that - I get that ice isn't free but I'm not taking soda and I'm already paying for food. I think ice and water should be free and provided like public restrooms as a human necessity but that's just meeeeeee.
I've never had a sour or sassy white McDonalds employee. I also got yelled at by a hispanic cop for filling up my water bag with ice - but that was in the ghetto so it makes sense there.

Original filename: aita.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 49] Culinary school: >season with salt liberally >get the pan screaming hot >use
item.description:
Culinary school:
>season with salt liberally
>get the pan screaming hot
>use neutral oil with a high smoke point
>put the steak down and don't touch it, don't poke it, don't even look at it until it's time to flip
>flip once
>let it rest on the counter for as long as it was in the pan before you slice it
>kitchen is full of smoke with oil splattered all over and the steak is both over and under cooked at the same time with no crust

Actual cookery:
>don't salt the steak
>no oil
>drop it in a cold pan
>let the meat and pan come up to temperature together
>flip frequently at least once per minute
>slice as soon as its the temp you want it so it can bloom
>season right before serving
>wall to wall even pink color with a deep crust

Seriously is there anything "classical technique" isn't 100% wrong about? It's like the way people are taught to make steaks is exactly the opposite of what you're supposed to do

Original filename: SmartSelect_20250713_171547_Google.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 30] >the slowest hiker in the group sets the pace Should this apply 100% of the
item.description:
>the slowest hiker in the group sets the pace

Should this apply 100% of the time or is there some nuance? What if the slowest hiker in the group is also super experienced, has excellent navigational abilities, is comfortable hiking in the dark, and has no problem staying overnight in a tent/hammock/bivy if needed? Would it be the end of the world if the experienced but slow hiker were in the back of the group and could go at his own comfortable pace? The way I see it, the "slowest hiker in the group sets the pace" mantra only applies to inexperienced hikers who could get in serious trouble if he/she were separated from the pack. What say you, anons?

Original filename: 1752371476762397.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 33] Balkans
item.description:
Could you anons share your experiences in the Balkans, please?

I'm planning a 13 night journey in this region, through Bosnia & Herzegovina, Croatia, Montenegro, and Serbia. It will be a solo backpacking trip in the summer. I'm interested in history, architecture, pretty nature, nightlife, and social hostels.

Pic-related is Kotor, Montenegro, somewhere I plan to visit on this trip.

item.description:

Bros, this is one of the greatest cities on earth, please talk about your experiences here.

If you haven't been, I highly recommend it to any world traveler.

item.title: [ 37] Italian Travel
item.description:
Spending a week a friend's house in Venetto Italy. Went to Venice, Bologna, Rovigo, Verona, Revana, Forli.
Pros:
- Not insanely hot
- Amazing Food
- Beer is not as bad as I thought it woul be.
- Everyone looks good, the wops are actually white.
- Surprisingly affordable if you aren't dumb.
- People are ridiculously friendly, not used to this since I grew up with southerners and they're absolute scum.
- Verona is the most beautiful city I've ever seen.
- Trains are decent.

Cons:
- Niggers
- Jeets
- Abduls
- High Taxes if one were to live here.

Is it worth going to Florence tomorrow? Is it worth moving to Verona? For context, I am white with blue eyes.

Original filename: z4MpSyGSXd8fYvYFqaoYhlemjscQG9ss3uNN29AS.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [117] US National Parks are horribly run BLM+Nat Park service have a combined budge
item.description:
US National Parks are horribly run
BLM+Nat Park service have a combined budget of SEVEN FUCKING BILLION DOLLARS A YEAR
SEVEN BILLION
and they still charge 30-50 dollars for every single Nat Park and podunk tiny little monument
What the fuck do they do with all this money?
Almost every nat park and land management road is fucking atrocious
the parking lots are even worse
you need a HAZMAT suit to enter any nat park rest room
Why do they need 35 dollars per car fee to see some little indian ruins?
What exact is that money doing? The little pamphlet can't cost more than .20 cents
thats basically it as far as cost
they don't even have rangers manning a ticket booth any more for most
they have a shitty app you need and then buy tickets/pay random fees online (usually in areas with SHIT internet/cell service)
Every campsite in CO was closed when I went there, I guess they are throwing a little shit fit cuz Drumpf or something
Everything in Utah, AZ and NM was open.
Some campsites you can't even tell if there are spots until you have ALREADY paid to enter into the site, so if they are full, you paid and there's no way to get your money back

Original filename: 39563668-b07f-43c1-8cad-69d1e63fa33eHiResProxy.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [172] How important do you think a survival knife is? Do you think it is a rather no
item.description:
How important do you think a survival knife is?
Do you think it is a rather not needed item thats need can be superseded by a usual every day knife?
It is easier to just snap logs for a fire than to hack them with a survival knife.
This is of course not including raw survival where you are needing bushcraft and hunting skills to actually survive. Just general non normie tier camp holiday woodland camping.
